oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of Maradolipid
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SARPE, VA
KULKARNI, SS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ONE-POT PROTECTION
CORD-FACTOR ANALOGS
6,6'-DI-O-ACYLATED ALPHA,ALPHA-TREHALOSES
MYCOBACTERIUM-TUBERCULOSIS
DESICCATION RESISTANCE
TREHALOSE GLYCOLIPIDS
SCALE SYNTHESIS
DERIVATIVES
EFFICIENT
ALBUMIN
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The first synthesis of maradolipid, a unique dissymmetrically 6,6'-di-O-acylated trehalose glycolipid isolated from C. elegans, is accomplished in five steps starting from trehalose in 45% overall yield. The short synthesis relies on dissymmetrization of trehalose core via regioselective acylation of a 2,3,4,2',3',4'-hexa-O-TMS trehalose 6,6'-diol derivative as a key step.
